last_episode_to_air.name: Black Tie Showdown
last_episode_to_air.overview: A day of revelations and danger builds to the ultimate showdown between Todd and Atticus at the Crowley High Semi-Formal.

name: Todd and the Book of Pure Evil
original_name: Todd and the Book of Pure Evil
overview:
Todd and the Book of Pure Evil is a Canadian comedy/horror television series that follows a group of high school students who confront the effects of a demonic book. The series premiered on Space Channel on September 29, 2010 with two back-to-back episodes. The show was created for television by Craig David Wallace, Charles Picco, and Anthony Leo.

Todd and the Book of Pure Evil is based on the short film of the same title written by Craig David Wallace and Max Reid, and directed by Wallace. The short film was produced through the Canadian Film Centre’s Short Dramatic Film Programme, and kicked off an international festival tour by premiering at the Toronto International Film Festival in 2003. The series was developed for television through the National Screen Institute's Totally TV Program. A pilot for Todd and the Book of Pure Evil was shot for Space in 2009 in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Like the low-budget short film, the series uses supernatural elements, profanity, graphic violence and non-sequitur lines. Sci-fi veteran David Winning directed four episodes.

Each episode was produced with two variations of the audio track: a pre-watershed version with "clean" replacement dialogue dubbed in by the actors, and the original uncensored version with profanity.

episodes.name: Todd the Metal God
episodes.overview: Todd uses The Book to transform himself into a Heavy Metal guitar god to impress Jenny.

episodes.name: How to Make a Homunculus
episodes.overview: Hannah is desperate to win the science fair so she uses The Book to make a small magical creature that strangely looks like Todd.

episodes.name: Rock N' Roll Zombies Know Best
episodes.overview: Todd's attempts to make Jenny jealous backfires and nearly gets him and Curtis eaten by a couple of rocknroll zombies.

episodes.name: Gay Day
episodes.overview: When Crowley High's only gay student uses the book to make every boy gay like him, Todd's feelings for Jenny are put to the test.

episodes.name: Monster Fat
episodes.overview: Todd, who has an irrational fear of fat people, must fight an evil monster made from human fat when an obesity epidemic takes over the school.

episodes.name: Invasion of the Stupid Snatchers
episodes.overview: When Crowley High is overcome with an evil smoke that turns the students stupid, Hannah must step up and save the entire student body before it descends into a perverse chaso of moronitude

episodes.name: Terrible Twin Turf Tussle
episodes.overview: Todd is torn between jealousy and arousal when Jenny takes up lesbianism and inadvertently causes a pair of twin sisters to go to war with their evil clones.

episodes.name: Cockfight
episodes.overview: Todd and Curtis’ prank on a small-endowed bully backfires when the bully uses The Book to turn his tiny penis into a terrifying cockmonster.

episodes.name: Big Bad Baby
episodes.overview: Todd sets out to prove to Jenny that he’s father material by delivering a gigantic baby borne from the power of The Book, who proceeds to terrorize the school.

episodes.name: The Ghost of Chet Sukowski
episodes.overview: Todd is challenged to a deadly drag race by a basketball star possessed by a ghost from the 1950's who has put Jenny under his spell.

episodes.name: The Phantom of Crowley High
episodes.overview: While Atticus directs Todd and Jenny in the most fantastic musical Crowley High has ever seen, Curtis falls in love with the evil Phantom of Crowley High.

episodes.name: Checkmate
episodes.overview: Todd is prophesized to be the Pure Evil one, by a chess champion, who uses the power of The Book to see the future.

episodes.name: A Farewell to Curtis' Arm
episodes.overview: Curtis uses The Book to get a new arm, while Todd learns some disturbing news about his past and future.

episodes.name: Redirement Home
episodes.overview: Todd, Curtis and Hannah break into the retirement home to rescue Jenny from the Cult, now run by Atticus

episodes.name: The Student Body
episodes.overview: Todd breaks up with the Gang, but intervenes when they join a dangerous new social group.

episodes.name: Daddy Tissues
episodes.overview: Skinned Bodies pile up in the school's bathrooms; Jenny realizes her father isn't a hero.

episodes.name: Simply The Beast
episodes.overview: Cheerleaders start disappearing and Todd, Jenny, and Atticus try to solve the mystery in their own ways.

episodes.name: Jungle Fever
episodes.overview: Hannah must dominate a neanderthal gang.

episodes.name: Fisting Fantasy
episodes.overview: The gang is trapped in a video game and must slay the Red Knight

episodes.name: See You Later, Masturbator
episodes.overview: Jimmy is fired for peeping on students and Todd vows to clear his name, but the Gang find the real culprit difficult to identify - because he's invisible!

episodes.name: Loser Generated Content
episodes.overview: The A/V Club use the Book to turn the Gang's lives into a psycho thriller - and they've cast Jenny as the victim and Todd as the killer!

episodes.name: Deathday Cake
episodes.overview: Jenny plays peacemaker as Todd and Hannah compete to throw Curtis the ultimate birthday bash, but a killer cake hopes to celebrate Curtis' deathday!

episodes.name: 2 Girls, 1 Tongue
episodes.overview: It's up to Hannah to save the day when Curtis' ex-girlfriend, the Phantom of Crowley High, returns to play musical mayhem with the Gang's love lives.

episodes.name: B.Y.O.B.O.P.E.
episodes.overview: Todd and Curtis vow to lose their virginities during a house party, but two uninvited guests make things complicated - the Book and Atticus.

episodes.name: The Toddyssey
episodes.overview: Todd uses a time-traveling paraplegic student as a taxi to the future, where he sees what the world could become without him.

episodes.name: Black Tie Showdown
episodes.overview: A day of revelations and danger builds to the ultimate showdown between Todd and Atticus at the Crowley High Semi-Formal.
